post_text:
Due to the extreme temperatures this week, the Schaumburg Terminal of First Student transportation company has not been able to get school buses started. Because of this mechanical failure, the decision has been made to CANCEL school tomorrow, Friday, February 1.

First Student cannot guarantee reliable service to ensure the safety of our students, which means that ALL Bloomingdale School District 13 schools will be closed, Friday, February 1.

First Student will be working through the weekend to ensure all buses will be ready for Monday morning to resume school on February 4.
text:
Due to the extreme temperatures this week, the Schaumburg Terminal of First Student transportation company has not been able to get school buses started. Because of this mechanical failure, the decision has been made to CANCEL school tomorrow, Friday, February 1.

First Student cannot guarantee reliable service to ensure the safety of our students, which means that ALL Bloomingdale School District 13 schools will be closed, Friday, February 1.

First Student will be working through the weekend to ensure all buses will be ready for Monday morning to resume school on February 4.

post_text: Congratulations to the August Exemplar Award Recipients!
text: Congratulations to the August Exemplar Award Recipients!

post_text:
“Did You Know?”
Bloomingdale School District 13 is a unique and special school district in many ways. One of the most identifiable ways is by the District’s employment of paraprofessionals. Combining all three buildings, 48 paraprofessionals serve Bloomingdale students; 32 as general education parapros and 16 as special education parapros. More than just “teacher aides”, Bloomingdale School District 13 paraprofessionals are, in most cases, certified teachers. These highly trained individuals support instruction daily and are able to lead classrooms in the absence of the assigned teacher. Last year, the District instructed 1,377 students in all three buildings combined. That means that the ratio of students to paraprofessionals in District 13 was 28.7 to 1. I challenge anyone to find another school district with a better ratio than District 13. (Hint: you won’t find one) The use of paraprofessionals is just one way Bloomingdale School District 13 stands apart from the rest!
text:
“Did You Know?”
Bloomingdale School District 13 is a unique and special school district in many ways. One of the most identifiable ways is by the District’s employment of paraprofessionals. Combining all three buildings, 48 paraprofessionals serve Bloomingdale students; 32 as general education parapros and 16 as special education parapros. More than just “teacher aides”, Bloomingdale School District 13 paraprofessionals are, in most cases, certified teachers. These highly trained individuals support instruction daily and are able to lead classrooms in the absence of the assigned teacher. Last year, the District instructed 1,377 students in all three buildings combined. That means that the ratio of students to paraprofessionals in District 13 was 28.7 to 1. I challenge anyone to find another school district with a better ratio than District 13. (Hint: you won’t find one) The use of paraprofessionals is just one way Bloomingdale School District 13 stands apart from the rest!

post_text:
Annual CHARACTER COUNTS! Recognition

Every spring the Bloomingdale CHARACTER COUNTS! Coalition sponsors a breakfast to recognize members of the community who live, work or attend school in Bloomingdale who exhibit outstanding character. Honorees are nominated with a description of the pillar of character that they exemplify. The 16th Annual Recognition Program will be held on Saturday, May 6, 2017 at the Bloomingdale Golf Club.

To learn more about and/or submit a nomination, please visit the Bloomingdale CHARACTER COUNTS! Coalition website, http://www.character60108.org/, (top of page). Nominations are due by no later than March 31, 2017.
text:
Annual CHARACTER COUNTS! Recognition

Every spring the Bloomingdale CHARACTER COUNTS! Coalition sponsors a breakfast to recognize members of the community who live, work or attend school in Bloomingdale who exhibit outstanding character. Honorees are nominated with a description of the pillar of character that they exemplify. The 16th Annual Recognition Program will be held on Saturday, May 6, 2017 at the Bloomingdale Golf Club.

To learn more about and/or submit a nomination, please visit the Bloomingdale CHARACTER COUNTS! Coalition website, http://www.character60108.org/, (top of page). Nominations are due by no later than March 31, 2017.

post_text:
Bloomingdale 13 Education Foundation

Bloomingdale was selected! On February 28th the Bloomingdale MOD store will be hosting an all-day fundraiser for the Bloomingdale Education Foundation. Customers must present a printed or digital version of the attached flyer to the cashier for your organization to receive 20% of the sale on February 28th. All of the local SAP employees will be coming in on February 28th to support your cause!

post_text: Bloomingdale Police Officer Raymond Murrell was remembered today in an all-school assembly at DuJardin. Students led the audience in the Pledge of Allegiance and were very respectful during a moment of silence in Officer Murrell's honor. Students representing each grade level recited their pledges to be good citizens. The program ended with the presentation of a pledge scrapbook and bench that will be constructed in memory of Officer Murrell.
text: Bloomingdale Police Officer Raymond Murrell was remembered today in an all-school assembly at DuJardin. Students led the audience in the Pledge of Allegiance and were very respectful during a moment of silence in Officer Murrell's honor. Students representing each grade level recited their pledges to be good citizens. The program ended with the presentation of a pledge scrapbook and bench that will be constructed in memory of Officer Murrell.

post_text:
2017 Spelling Bee

Forty-five students representing Erickson, DuJardin, and Westfield competed Tuesday for the title of Spelling Bee Champion! Thank you to all our competitors for a job well done! Special thanks to our two event organizers, Rachel Sliwa and Amanda Gunther, as well as our three judges.

CONGRATULATIONS to 7th grader Nandan A. who claimed the title of "Champion"!
text:
2017 Spelling Bee

CONGRATULATIONS to 7th grader Nandan A. who claimed the title of "Champion"!

post_text:
2017-2018 Kindergarten Registration

Kindergarten registration for the 2017-2018 school year for students who will turn five on or before Sept. 1, 2017 will take place at DuJardin and Erickson Schools on the following dates and times:

Feb. 21 - 8:00-4:00 p.m.
Feb. 22 - 8:00-6:00 p.m.
Feb. 23 - 8:00-4:00 p.m.
Feb. 24 - 8:00-4:00 p.m.

Registration packets are available online and in the school office.. Completed packets should then be brought to the school office during any of the times listed above.

post_text: Congratulations to Ashley Z., seventh grader at Westfield, whose artwork crafted for the Lions Club International Peace Poster contest was selected and her entry has already won two levels of the competition. Ashley's entry now moves to the third level, which is a competition among winners of multiple districts. Should her entry win at this level, she moves on to the fourth and final level which is the international competition! We are so very proud of Ashley's accomplishments!
text: Congratulations to Ashley Z., seventh grader at Westfield, whose artwork crafted for the Lions Club International Peace Poster contest was selected and her entry has already won two levels of the competition. Ashley's entry now moves to the third level, which is a competition among winners of multiple districts. Should her entry win at this level, she moves on to the fourth and final level which is the international competition! We are so very proud of Ashley's accomplishments!

Finance Forum

With the aid of a slide presentation and hand-out at last night's Finance Forum, Superintendent Jon Bartelt and Finance Director John Reiniche provided information for a better understanding of how the District is funded, and how spending decisions are made.

The slide presentation will be available on the District's website: www.sd13.org.

SPECIIAL SCHOOL BOARD MEETING TONIGHT

A special meeting will be held at Westfield Middle School, 149 Fairfield Way at 7:00 p.m. for the purpose of offering the community an opportunity to hear about Bloomingdale District 13 finances. Please join us as Superintendent Jon Bartelt and Finance Director John Reiniche present information on finances and answer any questions you might have on the topic.

post_text:
The 8th annual Bloomingdale Chamber of Commerce "50 Men Who Cook" event held September 24 at Hilton Indian Lakes was successful once again, with a portion of the proceeds benefitting Bloomingdale area schools!

Thank you to all the cooks, sponsors, and volunteers for your help with the event! A special thank you to the students from Lake Park High School's Jazz Combo for entertaining us throughout the evening!
text:
The 8th annual Bloomingdale Chamber of Commerce "50 Men Who Cook" event held September 24 at Hilton Indian Lakes was successful once again, with a portion of the proceeds benefitting Bloomingdale area schools!

Thank you to all the cooks, sponsors, and volunteers for your help with the event! A special thank you to the students from Lake Park High School's Jazz Combo for entertaining us throughout the evening!

post_text: Please join us this Saturday evening, September 24, 6-8 p.m. for the annual 50 Men Who Cook event held at Hilton Indian Lakes, sponsored by the Bloomingdale Chamber of Commerce. For more details, please visit the Chamber's website at www.bloomingdalechamber.com
text: Please join us this Saturday evening, September 24, 6-8 p.m. for the annual 50 Men Who Cook event held at Hilton Indian Lakes, sponsored by the Bloomingdale Chamber of Commerce. For more details, please visit the Chamber's website at www.bloomingdalechamber.com

HUNGER AWARENESS MONTH

Students will wear the color orange on Sept. 1 in support of hunger awareness. During the entire month of September, collection bins provided by Feeding America will be available at our schools for donations of non-perishable food items. Your donations are very much appreciated!!

post_text:
DuPage Spring Leadership Conference

Co-chairs Dr. Jon Bartelt and Dr. John Butts are to be commended for their hard work in organizing a very successful conference for superintendents in Galena this past weekend! Dr. Tim Elmore, keynote speaker, presented during this 3-day conference, and his message was well received by all attendees. Special thanks to corporate sponsors: PMA/Forecast5, Siemens, IHC Construction, TCG Group, Single Path, Hodges Loizzi, Fanning-Howey, & Cook-Illinois!!
text:
DuPage Spring Leadership Conference

Dr. Tim Elmore, keynote speaker, presented during this 3-day conference, and his message was well received by all attendees. Special thanks to corporate sponsors: PMA/Forecast5, Siemens, IHC Construction, TCG Group, Single Path, Hodges Loizzi, Fanning-Howey, & Cook-Illinois!!

post_text: Thank you School Board Members Diane Birkley, Terry McKeown, and Cary Moreth for giving your time to attend the National School Boards Conference in Boston!
